comment_data.diff_hunk:

   return path
 end
 
+-- Replace with built in vim.version tostring that was added in neovim v0.10
+-- Used mainly for printing out of date version, so after v0.10 is no longer
+-- supported at least
+function M.version_string(version)

```suggestion
  assert(version.major and version.minor and version.patch, 'invalid vim.Version table')
```

comment_data.body: This is true, I moved it to being a local function. I also added checking to make sure the minimum version is able to be parsed as well
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -428,4 +428,20 @@ function M.strip_archive_subpath(path)
   return path
 end
 
+-- Replace with built in vim.version tostring that was added in neovim v0.10
+-- Used mainly for printing out of date version, so after v0.10 is no longer
+-- supported at least
+---@param version vim.Version
+function M.version_string(version)

comment_data.body: `vim.version.parse` was not available in older versions, that's why it was intentionally not used.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,10 +92,12 @@ end
 
 local minimum_neovim_version = '0.9'
 if vim.fn.has('nvim-' .. minimum_neovim_version) == 0 then
+  local minimum_vim_version = vim.version.parse(minimum_neovim_version)

comment_data.body: oh interesting, `vim.version.parse` was used. I was just moving it. How would you like to resolve it?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,10 +92,12 @@ end
 
 local minimum_neovim_version = '0.9'
 if vim.fn.has('nvim-' .. minimum_neovim_version) == 0 then
+  local minimum_vim_version = vim.version.parse(minimum_neovim_version)

comment_data.body: Ok, I moved it to just use the string rather than using `vim.version.parse` like the code was using originally
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,10 +92,12 @@ end
 
 local minimum_neovim_version = '0.9'
 if vim.fn.has('nvim-' .. minimum_neovim_version) == 0 then
+  local minimum_vim_version = vim.version.parse(minimum_neovim_version)

comment_data.body:
`vim.version()` has been around [longer](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/61437c20b5936de1f833d155b7287d9151e763d8) than `.parse()`, so that's why it's ok to use it. But to be extra safe, we could do:

```suggestion
    version_string(vim.version and vim.version() or 'older than v0.5.0')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -80,8 +94,8 @@ local minimum_neovim_version = '0.9'
 if vim.fn.has('nvim-' .. minimum_neovim_version) == 0 then
   local msg = string.format(
     'nvim-lspconfig requires Nvim version %s, but you are running: %s',
-    vim.version.parse(minimum_neovim_version),
-    vim.version()
+    minimum_neovim_version,
+    version_string(vim.version())

comment_data.body: I like it, I'll add this with some fixes

title: fix: support printing version tables in neovim <0.10
